chargeHist.descr: Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device (Victim < 18 years old)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric M. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Invade Privacy - Use Surveillance Device, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 942.08(2)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DE to complete pscho/sexual assessment and followthrough.  DE not to have unsupervised contact with his children, M.P.A., dob 9/24/09 nor T.J.A., dob 10/12/11 unless this assessment is completed and at the discretion of probation agent.
Defendant may not have contact with the victim, B.R.P.

timeConds.notes: Jail term is with huber and is to commence within 30 days of 12/12/16 with continued obedience to bond and subject to probation agents approval. May be served in any county.
DE to complete 50 hours of uncompensated community service with agents approval.

records.addlTxt: DNA submission form
See minutes under plea and sentencing

2:33 pm - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Eric M. Anderson appeared with attorney Kevin G. Klein.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties want to move to plea and sentencing.  Information has been filed, acknowledged and reading is waived.  Victim impact statement filed.  DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to all counts.  Court questions DE regarding the plea.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC.  Statement given by victims mother, C.A.  DE to submit a DNA sample at PRSO.  Court imposes:

Ct 1 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
$200 DNA
30 days jail with huber and is to commence within 30 days of 12/12/16, with continued obedience to bond and subject to probation agent approval.
50 hours uncompensated community service with probation agents approval.  May be served in any county.
Pscho/sexual assessment and followthrough.  DE not to have unsupervised contact with his children, M.P.A., dob 9/24/09 nor T.J.A., dob 10/12/11 unless assessment is completed and at the discretion of probation agent.
No contact with victim B.R.P.

Ct 2 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
Conditions of probation
$243 cc
Pscho/sexual assessment and followthrough.  DE not to have unsupervised contact with his children, M.P.A., dob 9/24/09 nor T.J.A., dob 10/12/11 unless this is completed and at the discretion of probation agent.
No contact with victim B.R.P.


Appeal rights given.
Preliminary hearing on December 12, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Preliminary hearing on September 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Eric M. Anderson not in court.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders current bond forfeited.  Court orders warrant $3000 cash plus warrant exe fee.  10:02 am - DE appears and warrant is lifted.  DE plans to retain an attorney.  Court gives DE another notice of right to atty.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.

Defendant may not view or possess pornographic material.

10:30am Defendant Eric M. Anderson appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin (by telephone).  Case called, appearances and possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 6/21/16 at 10:00am.  Court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states recommendation.  Court grants DA 5 business days in which to file complaint. Court sets $5,000.00 signature bond with conditions.
